full_text:
### Update v38.00

#### November 1st 2025 Hotfix

No information provided in patch notes.

### Update v38.10

#### November 11th 2025

- Homer Simpson thought it'd be a great idea to use the power of the Zero Point on a donut-shaped cloud to make it rain donuts.

  * Numerous frosted sprinkled donuts can be found littered around the map.
  * A Donut Storm may form on the Island after a Storm phase.

  * Giant donuts fall from the sky and destroy any buildings or players underneath.
  * They can bounce around or get embedded in the ground.
  * They may have chests on them.

### Update v38.11

#### November 19th 2025

* Homer Simpson attempted to discard the Zero Point Shard by throwing it into the only trash bin he knows — a radioactive fuel pool in the Nuclear Power Plant's core. This causes a chemical reaction that overruns Springfield Island with Zero Point energy:

  + Springfield Nuclear Power Plant is now constantly erupting. Due to the effects of the Zero Point Shard, the Nuclear Plant is now an established low-gravity zone.
  + Cletus' Corn Hole is now glowing pink, with the Zero Point energy seeping into the crops there.
  + Lake Springfield and neighboring bodies of water are now laced with Zero Point energy, turning them pink.
* A countdown activated in the middle of Springfield Town Square.

#### November 19th 2025 (08:00 ET)

* A giant cloud fused with Zero Point energy appeared near the Springfield Island.

#### November 21st 2025

- The giant cloud starts resembling Homer Simpson, curled up in a fetal position.

#### November 23rd 2025

* The Homer Simpson cloud becomes more defined.

#### November 25th 2025

* The giant cloud coalesces into a giant version of Homer Simpson.

  * Springfield Town Square is partially damaged amidst Homer's rampage, destroying the Gentleman's Barber Shop.
  * Homer can now be found off the Island and into the ocean.
* All Storm zones have been changed to be in the shape of the number 7.
* KBBL Radio Towers were disabled.

#### November 25th 2025 (10:00 ET)

* Storm zones were reverted back to the traditional circle shape.
* KBBL Radio Towers were re-enabled.
